DOC.detailed_description: Background : This study design assess effectiveness Health Education Program ( HEP ) improve well-being reduce health care use cost care frail old outpatient veteran , improve well-being spouse caregiver . HEP multi-component group program deliver 8 weekly , 2-hour session , 10 monthly 2-hour follow-up session , include emotion-focused problem focus cop strategy , education support . Objectives : The objective study evaluate : 1 ) effect HEP perceive health status , emotional well-being , social support frail veteran ; 2 ) effect HEP perceive health , emotional well-being , social support , burden level , self-appraisal change , press problem associate caregiving , knowledge use community resource caregiver ; 3 ) effect HEP health care use cost care recipient . Methods : HEP evaluate use randomize control group design . The design two level intervention , HEP vs. Usual Care ( UC ) , 3 VA medical center ( VAMCs ) , 4 time measurement ( baseline , 8th HEP meeting , 1 2 year baseline ) . Data report 8 week 1-year psychosocial outcome 18 month VA cost . Caregivers veteran ( n = 466 ) randomize 3 VAMCs , 114 UC 119 HEP . The typical caregiver 68 year old , married , white , female , college education living veteran . The typical veteran care recipient 74 year old , white , male college education , suffer one chronic health problem . Fifteen HEP group conduct . Caregivers recipient assess : 1 ) health functional status ; 2 ) emotional well-being ; 3 ) social support . In addition , caregiver assess change cop skill , change burden level , press problem , knowledge use community resource . Data analyze use random effect regression model . Status : Data two-year outcome health functional status , emotional well-being , social support caregiver veteran , problem associate caregiving Medicare plus VA cost collect analyzed amend final report .
